lead_paragraph: The owners of the political magazine The New Republic, who include Martin Peretz, the magazine's longtime editor in chief, are considering selling the magazine or creating a strategic partnership with new investors, DealBook reported. They have hired the Blackstone Group to run the sales process, people briefed on the matter said on Tuesday. About a half-dozen potential suitors have held early conversations, including Jared Kushner, the owner of The New York Observer; Thomson Reuters; Yahoo; and Bloomberg L.P. According to industry executives, other suitors could include the Washington Post Company; AOL's Huffington Post division; and the Atlantic Media Company. Read more at DealBook»

headline.main: The New Republic's Owners Consider a Sale
